embeds.title: Hermit 2
embeds.description:
Act 2 Boss

**Wheel of Fortune** - Whenever you strike Hermit with an Attack, its leftmost card is discarded and it draws a card. Every 6 times this happens, Hermit gains 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.

**Cards**: Showdown+, Strike+, Strike, Defend, Desperado, Wide Open+, Hole Up, Flash Powder(+), Itchy Trigger, Hand of Greed, Virtue+, Maintenance+, Necronomicurse

**Relics**: Necronomicon, Philosopher's Stone, Pen Nib

messages.content: this guy is cool
I really like the mechanic of being able to control his intents
stone calendar was a good relic choice over the old pen nib
pen nib was buggy as hell
Ew yucky me no likey
I like this concept, but I feel it gives the player too much control in its current iteration
most of the time I can just cycle this guy back to a set of 3 cards that do very little damage
makes the fight feel kind of samey to me
Hermit 2, watching as i cycle him back to the same cards for the 4th time this combat
I might have mentioned this before, but I think hermit 2 and 3 concepts could be switched and be a lot more fun that way
Impending Doom doesn't do enough damage to be threatening in act 3, but it might be threatening in act 2, and act 3 opens up more aggressive possibilities for roulette hermit
hermit 2 actually feels like you kinda need to prioritize if you don’t have piles of attacks to control his cards ngl

except it ignites like every 3 turns and also saps your energy but your draw less

Eh hexa feels more like it is intended that you deal with it in some way (race to kill it before the 2nd ignite or have something prepared for it) whereas with defect 1 it feels more like a "kill in x turns or suffer"

I will say, I haven't played this fight very much since the stone calendar change. With calendar, you have two main strategies available to you, race it fast and try to kill before calendar, or play a longer scaling game with some plan to block the big calendar turn (plenty of characters get intangible or other similar invulnerable turns, guardian can time defensive mode, calipers, runic pyramid to line mitigation up). If you have high enough max HP and/or have already broken the blue key, you can also rest at the latest campfire and attempt to facetank the calendar. 

It's a very unusual fight in that it rewards cheap attacks with its wheel of fortune mechanic. Having good access to 0 cost attacks, or 1 cost attacks and 4 energy to cast them, lets you have alot of control over what hermit is doing. Usually you really want to push out the 2 cost cards to deny necronomicon, as well as wide open, and maintenance to deny scaling. Most characters should have enough scaling to be fine against flash powder resolving at this point in the run. The critical thing is to have enough attacks to control the intent, as well as either very fast burst damage, or good defensive scaling/some way to line up an intangible card. This fight is consistently threatening in my experience, and can definitely kill you if you are unprepared or don't find the right tools in time. Most of the time, as long as you have enough ability to control the intent, you should make it through just fine.
<heroic bravo> <purgatory>
